Properties.ProtectedString:
local clicks = 0 local con = nil
script.Parent.Equipped:connect(function(mouse) script.Name = "TicTac_LocalMain_Selected" --when clicked look for an opponent con = mouse.Button1Down:connect(function() --check for a humanoid --OR hack for quick elimination of possible "no mouse.Target" condition local humanoid = (mouse.Target or game.Workspace).Parent:FindFirstChild("Humanoid") if (humanoid) then local torso = humanoid.Parent:FindFirstChild("Torso") if torso then if humanoid then --check if the humanoid belongs to a player local player = game.Players:playerFromCharacter(humanoid.Parent) if player then --replicate the opponent value to the server sided script script.Parent.Opponent.Value = player -- clicks = clicks + 1 script.Name = tostring(clicks) end end end end end) end)
script.Parent.Unequipped:connect(function() if con then con:disconnect() con = nil end script.Name = "TicTac_LocalMain_NotSelected" end)

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------- cleans up the opponent's stuff if the player leaves
game.Players.ChildRemoved:connect(function(p) if p == script.Challenger.Value then script.Cleanup.Value:remove() script:remove() end end)

local gameState = 0 --[[ 0 = no game 1 = waiting for opponent to accept or decline 2 = game running 3 = game over message pending ]]
local gameTurn = true --[[ true = your turn false = opponents turn
acts as a spinlock for the main loop ]]
local resourceGui = script.Parent.Connect4Gui resourceGui.Parent = nil local opponentGui = nil local playerGui = nil --[[ the guis for your and the opponent ]]
local opponentCleanupScript = nil --[[ script to clean up the opponent's gui if I leave ]]
local gameBoard = {{h = 8},{h = 8},{h = 8},{h = 8},{h = 8},{h = 8},{h = 8},{h = 8}} --[[ the gameboard, values := [0 = empty, 1 = player, 2 = opponent] ]]
local player = nil local opponent = nil --[[ me and the opponent, (and possibly other players / viewers in other games) ]]
local opponentChangedSignal = nil --[[ signal must be connected when the tool is deselected, unlike mouse ones which expire automatically ]]
function hasWon(num) --check rows for x = 1, 5 do for y = 1, 8 do local row = true for i = 0, 3 do if gameBoard[x+i][y] ~= num then row = false break end end if row then return true end end end --check cols for x = 1, 8 do for y = 1, 5 do local col = true for i = 0, 3 do if gameBoard[x][y+i] ~= num then col = false break end end if col then return true end end end --check diagonals for x = 1, 5 do for y = 1, 5 do local diag = true for i = 0, 3 do if gameBoard[x+i][y+i] ~= num then diag = false break end end if diag then return true end end end --check inverse diagonals for x = 4, 8 do for y = 1, 5 do local diag = true for i = 0, 3 do if gameBoard[x-i][y+i] ~= num then diag = false break end end if diag then return true end end end return false end
function boardFull() for x = 1, 8 do for y = 1, 8 do if gameBoard[x][y] == 0 then return false end end end return true end
function setupPlayerBoard() for x = 1, 8 do local coordStr = tostring(x) playerGui.MainFrame.BoardFrame[coordStr].MouseButton1Down:connect(function() if gameTurn and gameBoard[x].h > 0 then gameBoard[x][gameBoard[x].h] = 1 gameBoard[x].h = gameBoard[x].h - 1 -- local pc = playerGui.MainFrame.BoardPiece:clone() pc.Image = "http://www.roblox.com/asset/?id=17081793" pc.Parent = playerGui.MainFrame.BoardFrame pc.Position = UDim2.new(0, 32*(x-1), 0, 32*gameBoard[x].h) pc.Visible = true -- local pc = opponentGui.MainFrame.BoardPiece:clone() pc.Image = "http://www.roblox.com/asset/?id=17081793" pc.Parent = opponentGui.MainFrame.BoardFrame pc.Position = UDim2.new(0, 32*(x-1), 0, 32*gameBoard[x].h) pc.Visible = true -- gameTurn = false end end) playerGui.MainFrame.BoardFrame[coordStr].MouseEnter:connect(function() if gameBoard[x].h > 0 then playerGui.MainFrame.BoardFrame[coordStr].Image = "http://www.roblox.com/asset/?id=17081799" end end) playerGui.MainFrame.BoardFrame[coordStr].MouseLeave:connect(function() playerGui.MainFrame.BoardFrame[coordStr].Image = "" end) end end
function setupOpponentBoard() for x = 1, 8 do local coordStr = tostring(x) opponentGui.MainFrame.BoardFrame[coordStr].MouseButton1Down:connect(function() if not gameTurn and gameBoard[x].h > 0 then gameBoard[x][gameBoard[x].h] = 2 gameBoard[x].h = gameBoard[x].h - 1 -- local pc = playerGui.MainFrame.BoardPiece:clone() pc.Image = "http://www.roblox.com/asset/?id=17081775" pc.Parent = playerGui.MainFrame.BoardFrame pc.Position = UDim2.new(0, 32*(x-1), 0, 32*gameBoard[x].h) pc.Visible = true -- local pc = opponentGui.MainFrame.BoardPiece:clone() pc.Image = "http://www.roblox.com/asset/?id=17081775" pc.Parent = opponentGui.MainFrame.BoardFrame pc.Position = UDim2.new(0, 32*(x-1), 0, 32*gameBoard[x].h) pc.Visible = true -- gameTurn = true end end) opponentGui.MainFrame.BoardFrame[coordStr].MouseEnter:connect(function() if gameBoard[x].h > 0 then opponentGui.MainFrame.BoardFrame[coordStr].Image = "http://www.roblox.com/asset/?id=17081799" end end) opponentGui.MainFrame.BoardFrame[coordStr].MouseLeave:connect(function() opponentGui.MainFrame.BoardFrame[coordStr].Image = "" end) end end
function createPlayerGui() --remove the old gui if playerGui then playerGui:remove() end --set up the player's GUI playerGui = resourceGui:clone() playerGui.Parent = player.PlayerGui playerGui.SideFrame.Visible = true setupPlayerBoard() --make the popupframe hide on ok pressed playerGui.PopupFrame.Accept.MouseButton1Down:connect(function() --hack, this must be the gameover message if gameState is 3, reset game state if gameState == 3 then playerGui.MainFrame.Visible = false playerGui.SideFrame.TXT1.Text = "Click on a player to" playerGui.SideFrame.TXT2.Text = "challenge them" playerGui.SideFrame.Visible = true Spawn(function() for i = -128, 0, 4 do playerGui.SideFrame.Position = UDim2.new(0, i, 0.5, -16) wait() end end) gameState = 0 end --hide me playerGui.PopupFrame.Visible = false end) end
function playGame() --== create a new board for the player (reusing old one causes some rendering bugs with the x and o images) createPlayerGui() --==set up the opponent's gui connections (the player's are setup on tool selection) setupOpponentBoard() --==hide the player's sideframe Spawn(function() for i = 0, -128, -4 do playerGui.SideFrame.Position = UDim2.new(0, i, 0.5, -16) wait() end end) --==set turn and gamestate local gameRunning = true gameTurn = true gameState = 2 --reset the board, and the player's board gui for x = 1, 8 do gameBoard[x].h = 8 playerGui.MainFrame.BoardFrame[x].Image = "" for y = 1, 8 do gameBoard[x][y] = 0 end end --==connection for if the opponent leaves local opponentLeftSignal = game.Players.ChildRemoved:connect(function(p) if p == opponent then gameState = 3 playerGui.MainFrame.Visible = false playerGui.PopupFrame.TXT.Text = "Opponent has left" playerGui.PopupFrame.Visible = true end end) --==connection to put back the gui if the opponent dies local opponentDiedSignal = opponent.Changed:connect(function(property) if property == "Character" then opponentGui.Parent = opponent.PlayerGui end end) --==player died, panic and trash the game local playerDiedSignal = player.Character.Humanoid.Died:connect(function() --clean up connections to opponent opponentLeftSignal:disconnect() opponentDiedSignal:disconnect() --clean up opponentcleanup opponentCleanupScript:remove() --clean up guis opponentGui:remove() opponentGui = nil --player's is going to get cleaned up right anyways, TODO : maybe show a popup message --playerGui:remove() --playerGui = nil end) --=="quit" button pressed connections local playerQuitSignal = playerGui.MainFrame.InfoFrame.BN_Quit.MouseButton1Down:connect(function() playerGui.MainFrame.Visible = false playerGui.PopupFrame.TXT.Text = "You have quit the game" playerGui.PopupFrame.Visible = true -- opponentGui.MainFrame.Visible = false opponentGui.PopupFrame.TXT.Text = player.Name.." has quit, you win!" opponentGui.PopupFrame.Visible = true -- gameRunning = false gameTurn = not gameTurn end) local opponentQuitSignal = opponentGui.MainFrame.InfoFrame.BN_Quit.MouseButton1Down:connect(function() playerGui.MainFrame.Visible = false playerGui.PopupFrame.TXT.Text = opponent.Name.." has quit, you win!" playerGui.PopupFrame.Visible = true -- opponentGui:remove() opponentGui = nil -- gameRunning = false gameTurn = not gameTurn end) -- local piframe = playerGui.MainFrame.InfoFrame playerGui.MainFrame.Visible = true piframe.Opponent.TXT.Text = opponent.Name piframe.Turn.TXT.Text = "Your turn" piframe.PlayAs.IMG.Image = "http://www.roblox.com/asset/?id=17081793" local oiframe = opponentGui.MainFrame.InfoFrame opponentGui.MainFrame.Visible = true oiframe.Opponent.TXT.Text = player.Name oiframe.Turn.TXT.Text = "Opponent's turn" oiframe.PlayAs.IMG.Image = "http://www.roblox.com/asset/?id=17081775" --==enter the main gameloop while gameRunning do --wait for the spinlock, for a player to make a move local tmp = gameTurn while gameTurn == tmp do wait() end if not gameRunning then break end --change turn displays if gameTurn then piframe.Turn.TXT.Text = "Your turn" oiframe.Turn.TXT.Text = "Opponent's turn" else piframe.Turn.TXT.Text = "Opponent's turn" oiframe.Turn.TXT.Text = "Your turn" end --check for a win if hasWon(1) then --playerGui.MainFrame.Visible = false playerGui.PopupFrame.TXT.Text = "You have won!" playerGui.PopupFrame.Visible = true -- --opponentGui.MainFrame.Visible = false opponentGui.PopupFrame.TXT.Text = "You have lost =(" opponentGui.PopupFrame.Visible = true -- break elseif hasWon(2) then --playerGui.MainFrame.Visible = false playerGui.PopupFrame.TXT.Text = "You have lost =(" playerGui.PopupFrame.Visible = true -- --opponentGui.MainFrame.Visible = false opponentGui.PopupFrame.TXT.Text = "You have won!" opponentGui.PopupFrame.Visible = true -- break elseif boardFull() then --playerGui.MainFrame.Visible = false playerGui.PopupFrame.TXT.Text = "It's a tie!" playerGui.PopupFrame.Visible = true -- --opponentGui.MainFrame.Visible = false opponentGui.PopupFrame.TXT.Text = "It's a tie!" opponentGui.PopupFrame.Visible = true -- break end end --==disconnect the signals made opponentDiedSignal:disconnect() opponentLeftSignal:disconnect() playerQuitSignal:disconnect() opponentQuitSignal:disconnect() --==set the gamestate to gameover message pending gameState = 3 end
script.Parent.Equipped:connect(function() print("Connect4 Equipped") gameState = 0 gameTurn = true player = game.Players:playerFromCharacter(script.Parent.Parent) --listen for a player clicked notification sent from the localscript opponentChangedSignal = script.Parent.Opponent.Changed:connect(function() --was set to nil, ignore change if not script.Parent.Opponent.Value then print("Opponent value set back to nil") return end print("Clicked an opponent") --if there's no game, challenge this player if gameState == 0 then print("Starting game") --if they're already playing tictactoe then return if script.Parent.Opponent.Value.PlayerGui:FindFirstChild("Connect4Gui") then print("Opponent is already playing a game") if script.Parent.Opponent.Value.Character:FindFirstChild(script.Parent.Name) then playerGui.PopupFrame.TXT.Text = "Can't play a player with Four-In-A-Row equipped" playerGui.PopupFrame.Visible = true else playerGui.PopupFrame.TXT.Text = "Player is already playing a game" --Fix implemented by Luckymaxer playerGui.PopupFrame.Visible = true end wait(0.1) script.Parent.Opponent.Value = nil return end if (script.Parent.Opponent.Value.Character.Torso.Position - player.Character.Torso.Position).magnitude > 16 then playerGui.PopupFrame.TXT.Text = "Player is too far away" playerGui.PopupFrame.Visible = true wait(0.1) script.Parent.Opponent.Value = nil return end --set the gamestate gameState = 1 opponent = script.Parent.Opponent.Value wait(0.1) script.Parent.Opponent.Value = nil --set up the opponent's GUI opponentGui = resourceGui:clone() opponentGui.AcceptFrame.Visible = true opponentGui.AcceptFrame.TXT.Text = player.Name.." wants to play Four-In-A-Row with you!" --==set up the opponent's cleanup if this player leaves opponentCleanupScript = script.Parent.Connect4_OpponentCleanup:clone() opponentCleanupScript.Challenger.Value = player opponentCleanupScript.Cleanup.Value = opponentGui opponentCleanupScript.Disabled = false --should I put it straight in workspace or is that considered namespace pollution? that will work for now at least opponentCleanupScript.Parent = game.Workspace --on accept opponentGui.AcceptFrame.Accept.MouseButton1Down:connect(function() opponentGui.AcceptFrame.Visible = false playGame() end) --on decline opponentGui.AcceptFrame.Decline.MouseButton1Down:connect(function() --reset player's sideframes' text playerGui.SideFrame.TXT1.Text = "Click on a player to" playerGui.SideFrame.TXT2.Text = "challenge them" --show me a popup stating player declined playerGui.PopupFrame.TXT.Text = "Opponent Declined =(" playerGui.PopupFrame.Visible = true --reset the game state gameState = 0 --remove opponent gui opponentGui:remove() opponentGui = nil --remove opponent cleanup script opponentCleanupScript:remove() opponentCleanupScript = nil end) --hide popup on OK pressed opponentGui.PopupFrame.Accept.MouseButton1Down:connect(function() --only called on game waiting for over, delete this gui and "this player left" script if it exists if opponentCleanupScript then opponentCleanupScript:remove() opponentCleanupScript = nil end opponentGui:remove() opponentGui = nil end) --gui set up, add it opponentGui.Parent = opponent.PlayerGui --set the player's GUI playerGui.SideFrame.TXT1.Text = "Sending Challenge" playerGui.SideFrame.TXT2.Text = "Please wait..." else print("Game already started") wait(0.1) script.Parent.Opponent.Value = nil end end) --create the player's gui createPlayerGui() --pretty effects, scroll out the side frame for i = -128, 0, 4 do playerGui.SideFrame.Position = UDim2.new(0, i, 0.5, -16) wait() end print("Four-In-A-Row finished setup") end)
function doCleanUp() --clean up the guis if they exist if opponentGui then opponentGui:remove() opponentGui = nil end if playerGui then playerGui:remove() playerGui = nil end --remove the connection to opponentchanged opponentChangedSignal:disconnect() end
script.Parent.Unequipped:connect(function() print("Tool unequipped, clean up...") doCleanUp() --TODO: send some friendly notification to a possible --opponent that the player exited the map or deselected --the tool. As the player will have exited a separate --script is required for this end)

Properties.string: [player] wants to play Four-In-A-Row with you!
